snippet.desc: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right as well as in diagonal directions.
snippet.description: Allows the actor to move up, down, left and right as well as in diagonal directions.
snippet.name: 8 Way Movement

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will move in diagonal directions at the same speed as in axis-aligned directions.
If unselected, the actor will move in diagonal direction at a speed that is the sum of the axis-aligned velocities.
boolean.name: _NormalizeDiagonalSpeed

boolean.desc: If selected, the actor will not be able to turn while moving.
boolean.name: _StopTurningWhileMoving

boolean.desc:
If selected, the control attributes will be used to control the movement.
If unselected, the control attributes are ignored and the movement can be controlled by triggering custom events.
Trigger the events MoveUp, MoveDown, MoveLeft or MoveRight to make the actor move as if the keys were pressed.
boolean.name: _UseControls

number.desc: The speed of the movement.
number.name: _Speed

boolean.desc: If selected, the animation attributes will be used, otherwise they will be ignored.
boolean.name: _UseAnimations

boolean.desc: If selected and moving in a diagonal direction, the Up and Down animations will be used, otherwise the Left and Right animations will be used.
boolean.name: _PreferVerticalAnimtations

snippet.desc: Make the actor follow a given actor.
snippet.description: Make the actor follow a given actor.
snippet.name: Follow Target

actor.desc:
The target actor this actor will follow.
If the target actor is unset or dead this behavior will do nothing.
actor.name: _TargetActor

number.desc: The speed to move towards the target.
number.name: _Speed

number.desc: The actor will not move closer to the target than this value.
number.name: _Margin

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will move faster if farther away from the target and slower if closer to to the target.
If unselected, the actor will move towards the target at a constant speed as specified in the Speed attribute.
boolean.name: _Easing

number.desc:
Only used when Easing is selected.
The actor will move at least at this speed. The actual speed depends on the distance to the target. The maximum speed is Minimum Easing Speed plus Speed. The actor will move at maximum speed if it is in the opposite diagonal corner of the target.
number.name: _MinimumEasingSpeed

boolean.desc:
If selected, the actor will stop moving when colliding with the target actor.
If unselected, the actor will instead continue to and push the target around.
boolean.name: _StopwhenColliding

snippet.desc: Spawn a wave of bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.description: Spawn a wave of bullets from the actor's position.
snippet.name: Fire Bullet Wave

number.desc: The speed at which the bullets will move.
number.name: _BulletSpeed

actortype.desc: The bullet actor type to create.
actortype.name: _BulletType

number.desc:
The mean direction in which the bullet will move. The bullets will spread to the left and the right.
Only used if Direction Mode is Relative or Absolute. If Direction Mode is Based on Animations the following four attributes determine the direction instead.
number.dropdown: North=-90 North East=-45 East=0 South East=45 South=90 South West=135 West=180 North West=-135
number.name: _Direction

number.desc: The offset in the direction of movement at which the bullets will be created.
number.name: _Offset

boolean.desc:
If selected, holding down the Fire Control will fire bullets.

You can also trigger the FireBullet event to fire a bullet.
boolean.name: _UseControls

boolean.desc: If selected, holding down the mouse will fire bullets.
boolean.name: _UsetheMouse

boolean.desc: If selected, no more than <var>Maximum Bullets Alive</var> can be alive at the same time.
boolean.name: _LimitBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of bullets to be alive at the same time. Only used if <var>Limit Bullets Alive</var> is selected.
number.name: _MaximumBulletsAlive

number.desc: The maximum number of bullets created per second.
number.name: _RateOfFire

number.desc:
The maximum ammunition the actor can have.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
number.name: _MaximumAmmunition

number.desc:
The current ammunition the actor has when created.
Only used if Use Ammunition is selected.
Trigger the Reload event to set the current ammunition to the maximum ammunition.
number.name: _CurrentAmmunition

boolean.desc: If selected, the current ammunition will be reduced by one on every shot.
boolean.name: _UseAmmunition

number.desc: The number of bullets in a wave.
number.name: _NumberofBullets

number.desc: The angle between the bullets in a wave.
number.name: _BulletSpread

text.desc: Shoot up if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _UpAnimations

text.desc: Shoot down if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _DownAnimations

text.desc: Shoot left if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _LeftAnimations

text.desc: Shoot right if the current animation name contains this text.
text.name: _RightAnimations

text.desc:
How to determine the direction of the bullets:

Relative - Treat Direction relative to the actor's orientation.
Absolute - Treat Direction as absolute.
Based on Animations - Determine the direction based on the current animation.
text.dropdown: Relative=Relative Absolute=Absolute Based on Animations=Based on Animations
text.name: _DirectionMode

snippet.desc:
Prevent the actor from leaving the scene.

The actor will still be able to leave the screen, but it cannot leave the scene.
snippet.description:
Prevent the actor from leaving the scene.

The actor will still be able to leave the screen, but it cannot leave the scene.
snippet.name: Cannot Exit Scene

snippet.desc: When attached, the actor will flicker the given number of times over the given number of seconds when it collides with something.
snippet.description: When attached, the actor will flicker the given number of times over the given number of seconds when it collides with something.
snippet.name: Flicker On Collision

number.desc: The amount of time, in seconds, that the actor should flicker for.
number.name: _FlickerTime

number.desc: The number of times the actor should flicker during the flickering period.
number.name: _NumberofFlickers

boolean.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE. Whether or not the actor is already flickering, useful for driving logic.
boolean.name: _Flickering

number.desc: The opacity to flicker back and forth with as a percent. 0 = completely transparent, 100 = completely opaque.
number.name: _FlickerOpacity

boolean.desc: If true, then the actor will fade smoothly to the given opacity, rather than flickering straight away. (This may be unnoticeable beyond a certain rate of flickers/second.)
boolean.name: _Fade

number.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE. A shortcut for the amount of time one flicker lasts.
number.name: _FlickerLength

snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make it die once it leaves the screen.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make it die once it leaves the screen.
snippet.name: Die On Leaving Screen

snippet.desc: Attach to an actor to make it die when it collides with something.
snippet.description: Attach to an actor to make it die when it collides with something.
snippet.name: Die On Collision

snippet.desc: Switch scene when an actor enters a region.
snippet.description: Switch scene when an actor enters a region.
snippet.name: Switch Scene on Enter Region

region.desc: The region which will trigger the scene switch.
region.name: _Region

actor.desc: The actor that will trigger the scene switch when entering the region.
actor.name: _Actor

boolean.desc: If selected, only switch scene, when <var>Switch Control</var> is pressed, while the actor is within the region.
boolean.name: _OnlySwitchOnKeyPress

control.desc: The Control to trigger the scene switch if <var>Only Switch On Key Press</var> is selected.
control.name: _SwitchControl

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the switch scene transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle

snippet.desc: Shows an intro title, which slides away after the specified time.
snippet.description: Shows an intro title, which slides away after the specified time.
snippet.name: Intro Title

boolean.desc: INTERNAL ATTRIBUTE. Whether or not the slide-off has started.
boolean.name: _Started

font.desc: The font to use when drawing the intro title. Specify from the list of fonts you have created in Stencyl.
font.name: _FontToUse

number.desc: The amount of time, in seconds, before that the intro title should wait before beginning its exit of the screen.
number.name: _TimeBeforeRetreat

number.desc: The y-position, in screen coordinates, of the centre of the Intro Title.
number.name: _YCentrePosition

text.desc: Show this text in the Intro Title. Leave blank to use the scene's name.
text.name: _AlternativeText

number.desc: The initial speed to slide off the screen at.
number.name: _SlideSpeed

boolean.desc: Should a rounded rectangle be drawn behind the text?
boolean.name: _DrawRectangle

number.desc: The x-position, in screen coordinates, of the centre of the Intro Title.
number.name: _XCentrePosition

color.desc: The fill colour for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
color.name: _FillColour

color.desc: The stroke colour for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn. (Stroke is the outline).
color.name: _StrokeColour

number.desc: The thickness, in pixels, of the stroke around the outside of the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
number.name: _StrokeThickness

number.desc: Padding around the text, in pixels, for the rounded rectangle behind the text, if one is drawn.
number.name: _Padding

number.desc: The amount the rounded rectangle is rounded, if one is drawn. (Use 0 for right-angled corners).
number.name: _Rounding

text.desc: The direction the Intro Title slides away to.
text.name: _SlideDirection

number.desc: The slide speed is incremented by this value every update.
number.name: _SlideSpeedChange

snippet.desc: Switch scene when the user clicks or touches the screen.
snippet.description: Switch scene when the user clicks or touches the screen.
snippet.name: Switch Scene on Click or Touch

number.desc: The time to transition out, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise the time to transition out and in.
number.name: _OutTime

number.desc: The time to transition in, in seconds, if one of the first six Transition Styles is used. Otherwise it is ignored.
number.name: _InTime

text.desc: The style to use for the switch scene transition.
text.dropdown: Fade=Fade Blinds=Blinds Bubbles=Bubbles Spotlight=Spotlight Blur=Blur Box=Box Crossfade=Crossfade Slide Up=Slide Up Slide Down=Slide Down Slide Left=Slide Left Slide Right=Slide Right
text.name: _TransitionStyle
